t: Proverbs 8
The Excellence of Wisdom
Does*pn not wisdom cry out, And*ld understanding lift up her voice?
She*ld takes her stand on the top of the high hill, Beside*ld the way, where the paths meet.
She*ld cries out by the gates, at the entry of the city, At*ld the entrance of the doors:
“To*ld you, O men, I call, And*ld my voice is*i to the sons of men.
O*ld you simple ones, understand prudence, And*ld you fools, be of an understanding heart.
Listen,*ld for I will speak of excellent things, And*ld from the opening of my lips will*i come*i right things;
For*ld my mouth will speak truth; Wickedness*ld is*i an abomination to my lips.
All*ld the words of my mouth are*i with righteousness; Nothing*ld crooked or perverse is*i in them.
They*ld are*i all plain to him who understands, And*ld right to those who find knowledge.
Receive*ld my instruction, and not silver, And*ld knowledge rather than choice gold;
For*ld wisdom is*i better than rubies, And*ld all the things one may desire cannot be compared with her.
“I,*ln wisdom, dwell with prudence, And*ld find out knowledge and*i discretion.
The*ld fear of the Lord*s is*i to hate evil; Pride*ld and arrogance and the evil way And*ld the perverse mouth I hate.
Counsel*ld is*i mine, and sound wisdom; I*ld am*i understanding, I have strength.
By*ld me kings reign, And*ld rulers decree justice.
By*ld me princes rule, and nobles, All*ld the judges of the earth.
I*ld love those who love me, And*ld those who seek me diligently will find me.
Riches*ld and honor are*i with me, Enduring*ld riches and righteousness.
My*ld fruit is*i better than gold, yes, than fine gold, And*ld my revenue than choice silver.
I*ld traverse the way of righteousness, In*ld the midst of the paths of justice,
That*ld I may cause those who love me to inherit wealth, That*ld I may fill their treasuries.
“The*ln Lord*s possessed me at the beginning of His way, Before*ld His works of old.
I*ld have been established from everlasting, From*ld the beginning, before there was ever an earth.
When*ld there*i were*i no depths I was brought forth, When*ld there*i were*i no fountains abounding with water.
Before*ld the mountains were settled, Before*ld the hills, I was brought forth;
While*ld as yet He had not made the earth or the fields, Or*ld the primal dust of the world.
When*ld He prepared the heavens, I was*i there, When*ld He drew a circle on the face of the deep,
When*ld He established the clouds above, When*ld He strengthened the fountains of the deep,
When*ld He assigned to the sea its limit, So*ld that the waters would not transgress His command, When*ld He marked out the foundations of the earth,
Then*ld I was beside Him as*i a master craftsman; And*ld I was daily His*i delight, Rejoicing*ld always before Him,
Rejoicing*ld in His inhabited world, And*ld my delight was*i with the sons of men.
“Now*ln therefore, listen to me, my*i children, For*ld blessed are*i those*i who*i keep my ways.
Hear*ld instruction and be wise, And*ld do not disdain it.*i
Blessed*ld is the man who listens to me, Watching*ld daily at my gates, Waiting*ld at the posts of my doors.
For*ld whoever finds me finds life, And*ld obtains favor from the Lord;*s
But*ld he who sins against me wrongs his own soul; All*ld those who hate me love death.”
